tours.to: Day Trip from Marrakech to Essaouira
tours.titre: Day Trip from Marrakech to Essaouira - Marrakech Excursion

about.titre: Day Trip from Marrakech to Essaouira
about.paragraph1: Embark on a day trip from Marrakech to Essaouira, a charming coastal city known for its relaxed atmosphere, historic medina, and beautiful beaches.
about.paragraph2: This excursion offers culture, history, and scenic landscapes while escaping the bustling city of Marrakech.

programme.titre: ITINERARY DAY TRIP FROM MARRAKECH TO ESSAOUIRA

text: Departing from Marrakech early in the morning, you will enjoy a pleasant drive through the argan forests, an authentic and typical landscape of the region. Once you arrive in Essaouira, the guided tour begins with the discovery of the Skala of the City and the historic medina, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. You can then stroll through the fish market and the port, true hubs of city life where the maritime atmosphere is particularly charming.

After the tour, you'll have the option of having lunch at a local restaurant before enjoying some free time to relax on the beach or explore Essaouira at your own pace. At the end of the day, you'll head back towards Marrakech, with unforgettable memories of this coastal getaway.

infos.titre: Tour From Marrakech To Essaouira Informations

includes: Transport in a comfortable vehicle
English/French-speaking driver/guide
Pickup and drop-off at your accommodation in Marrakech

important.text: Wear comfortable shoes and bring water for the walk.

priceText.text: Contact us for the best price based on your group size.

listes.name: Sophie Martin – France
listes.comment: A wonderful day trip! Essaouira is charming and peaceful, and our guide was very knowledgeable. The medina and port were highlights. Highly recommended!

listes.name: James Thompson – United Kingdom
listes.comment: Beautiful coastal town with a relaxed vibe. The drive was smooth and the stops along the way were interesting. Would have loved a bit more time on the beach.

listes.name: Laura Garcia – Spain
listes.comment: Amazing experience! The Skala, the medina, and the fresh seafood made my day. Perfect escape from Marrakech’s hustle and bustle.

listes.question: How long does the trip take?
listes.repense: The excursion lasts approximately 10–11 hours.

listes.question: Is there free time in Essaouira?
listes.repense: Yes, you will have free time to explore the beach, medina, or port at your own pace.

listes.question: Do I need to book lunch in advance?
listes.repense: No, lunch is optional and can be chosen on-site from various local restaurants.

listes.question: Is the guided tour included?
listes.repense: Yes, a guided walking tour of the medina and Skala is included.

tours.to: Day Trip to Ouzoud Falls From Marrakech

about.titre: Day Trip from Marrakech to Ouzoud Falls
about.paragraph2: Discover the impressive Ouzoud falls, during this day trip. Ouzoud waterfalls are one of the most popular and spectacular wonders in Morocco, and also the second highest waterfall in Morocco at 110 m height. Firstly, we will pick you up, then head to the waterfalls about 160 km away from Marrakech. After that reach Ouzoud falls, then explore the area, and also enjoy the various activities (Optional). Finally, we return to Marrakech in the afternoon.

programme.titre: ITINERARY DAY TRIP FROM MARRAKECH TO OUZOUD FALLS

text: Ouzoud Falls day trip from Marrakech (10-11 hours total; 2.5-3 hours' drive each way): After an 08:00 pick-up from your riad/hotel, travel northeast through olive groves and Berber villages with a short comfort stop en route. Arrive around 10:45 at Ouzoud (Tanaghmeilt) for a brief orientation at the upper viewpoint, then walk down past terraces and stalls to mid-level lookouts and the base of the 110-metre cascades (steps/uneven paths in places). Enjoy free time on your own from roughly 12:15 to 14:00 to take the small boat near the falls (optional), relax by the river, or choose a café for lunch (own expense).

After lunch, you have more free time to cross the footbridge for alternate views, browse local stalls, and watch Barbary macaques. If you prefer minimal walking, you can remain on the upper terrace area and still enjoy excellent views while the rest of the group explores. Regroup by 15:30 at the upper car park, then depart for Marrakech with a comfort stop on the way, arriving around 18:00-18:30 for drop-off at your accommodation. Bring sun protection, closed non-slip shoes, and some cash for cafés/boat; expect spray near the base and warm midday temperatures.

infos.titre: Tour From Marrakech To Ouzoud Falls Informations

includes: transportation in a private 4x4 or a minivan with A/C +Fuel.
private Driver Speaking English.
Pick-up from your Raid or any Location in Marrakech
Drop Off at any Location in Marrakech
free Time in OUzoud
Stops on the way for panoramic views.

important.text: Wear comfortable shoes and bring water for the walk.

priceText.text: Contact us for the best price based on your group size.

listes.name: Sarah – United Kingdom
listes.comment: An absolutely wonderful day trip! Ouzoud Falls are breathtaking, and the whole experience was very well organized. Our driver was friendly and punctual, and we had plenty of free time to explore, take photos, and even enjoy a boat ride near the falls. Highly recommended for nature lovers.

listes.name: Marco – Italy
listes.comment: This was one of the highlights of our stay in Marrakech. The journey was comfortable, and the views along the way were beautiful. Ouzoud Falls are impressive, and we loved walking around the cascades and seeing the monkeys. A perfect escape from the city for a day.

listes.name: Amina – France
listes.comment: Très belle excursion ! Les chutes d’Ouzoud sont spectaculaires et l’organisation était excellente. Le chauffeur était professionnel et nous a laissé suffisamment de temps pour profiter du site à notre rythme. Je recommande vivement cette excursion.

listes.question: How long does the trip take?
listes.repense: The excursion lasts approximately 10–11 hours.

listes.question: Is there free time in Essaouira?
listes.repense: Yes, you will have free time to explore the beach, medina, or port at your own pace.

listes.question: Do I need to book lunch in advance?
listes.repense: No, lunch is optional and can be chosen on-site from various local restaurants.

listes.question: Is the guided tour included?
listes.repense: Yes, a guided walking tour of the medina and Skala is included.

tours.to: Day Trip from Marrakech to Ouarzazate and Ait Ben Haddou

about.titre: Day Trip from Marrakech to Ouarzazate and Ait Ben Haddou
list: Explore the scenic Tizi N-Tichka Pass at an altitude of 2,260 m.
Enjoy the breathtaking landscapes of the High Atlas Mountains.
Visit the Kasbah that is considered as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Enjoy a visit to the Atlas Studios.
Berber villages in the High Atlas mountain.

programme.titre: ITINERARY DAY TRIP FROM MARRAKECH TO OUARZAZATE AND AIT BEN HADDOU

jours.jour: Day 1: Marrakech - Ait Ben Haddou - Ouarzazate - Marrakech
text: The Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah and Ouarzazate day trip ( 8 Hours Drive Total) starts from Marrakech. The driver/guide will pick you up from your accommodation in the morning at 8:00 am. Then drive to Ouarzazate, also known as the gate of the desert. Firstly, we will stop in Ait berka village, at the beginning of High Atlas mountain range. Thereafter, we continue towards the summit of Tizi N-Tichka at 2260m above sea level. Enjoy the beautiful landscapes and impressive panoramic views of the High Atlas Mountains the highest mountain range in Morocco.

After that we drive to the kasbah of Ait ben haddou. The ancient kasbah that is listed as a the world heritage site of UNESCO. The kasbah is used for the shooting of several famous films like Asterix and Obelix: Mission Cleopatra, Lawrence of Arabia, Gladiator and also TV series such as Game Of Thrones. Lunch in the Kasbah. Then we continue towards the city of Ouarzazate. Where we stop to visit the cinema sudios, and also the Taourirt Kasbah. Finally we return to Marrakech in the afternoon, the driver will drop you off at your accommodation.

infos.titre: Tour From Marrakech To Ouarzazate and Ait Ben Haddou Informations

includes: transportation in a private 4x4 or a minivan with A/C +Fuel.
private Driver Speaking English.
Pick-up from your Raid or any Location in Marrakech
Drop Off at any Location in Marrakech
free Time in OUzoud
Stops on the way for panoramic views.

important.text: Wear comfortable shoes and bring water for the walk.

priceText.text: Contact us for the best price based on your group size.

listes.name: James – United States
listes.comment: An unforgettable day trip through the High Atlas Mountains. The drive via the Tizi N’Tichka Pass was spectacular, and Ait Ben Haddou exceeded all expectations. Visiting the kasbah felt like stepping into a movie set. Everything was well organized and the driver was very knowledgeable.

listes.name: Elena – Spain
listes.comment: A perfect combination of history, culture, and stunning landscapes. Ait Ben Haddou is truly impressive and Ouarzazate has a unique cinematic atmosphere. The stops along the way offered amazing panoramic views. Highly recommended for first-time visitors to Morocco.

listes.name: Thomas – Germany
listes.comment: Excellent excursion from Marrakech. The journey through the High Atlas Mountains was comfortable and scenic. We really enjoyed visiting the UNESCO-listed Ait Ben Haddou and learning about the movies filmed there. A long day, but absolutely worth it.

listes.question: How long does the trip take?
listes.repense: The excursion lasts approximately 10–11 hours.

listes.question: Is there free time in Essaouira?
listes.repense: Yes, you will have free time to explore the beach, medina, or port at your own pace.

listes.question: Do I need to book lunch in advance?
listes.repense: No, lunch is optional and can be chosen on-site from various local restaurants.

listes.question: Is the guided tour included?
listes.repense: Yes, a guided walking tour of the medina and Skala is included.

tours.to: Ourika Valley Day Trip From Marrakech

about.titre: Day Trip from Marrakech to Ourika Valley
about.paragraph1: Ourika Valley Day Trip: Visit the mountain villages and waterfalls of the Ourika Valley in a full-day excursion from Marrakech. Including: a hike from Setti Fatma, photography sessions in the spectacular mountains of the Atlas and also a visit to an argan oil production cooperative.
about.paragraph2: Enjoy a scenic drive of the valleys along the stream. Also visit a local Berber Market at Tnin Ourika village. Then enjoy the stunning views of lush green valleys with snow-capped Atlas Mountains as a backdrop. You can also wake up the active side of you and climb to the waterfalls. In addition to that treat yourself to a Berber Tagine next to the stream. Finally, the day trip end in Marrakech.

programme.titre: ITINERARY DAY TRIP FROM MARRAKECH TO OURIKA VALLEY

text: Ourika Valley Day Trip start at 9:00 am, from your hotel in Marrakech, then to the Atlas Mountains. Firstly, we take a short drive from Marrakech to the foothills of the Atlas Mountains. After that we continue our drive along the valley of Ourika and pass through successive mountain villages. As you go up the hills, we will make stops by various wonderful landscapes.

After that we make a stop in the village of Setti Fatma. Enjoy a short hike and discover beautiful waterfalls known for swimming, and take in breathtaking views of the surrounding valley from the trail.
After the Setti Fatma hike, you will see how argan oil is made in a local cooperative and you will be able to take pictures at the scenic vantage points where we will stop along the way.
Visit the Ourika valley and discover the village and the Berber culture.
Your day in the Atlas Mountains ends with a drop-off at your hotel.

infos.titre: Tour From Marrakech To Ourika Valley Informations

includes: transportation in a private 4x4 or a minivan with A/C +Fuel.
private Driver Speaking English.
Pick-up from your Raid or any Location in Marrakech
Drop Off at any Location in Marrakech
free Time in OUzoud
Stops on the way for panoramic views.

important.text: Wear comfortable shoes and bring water for the walk.

priceText.text: Contact us for the best price based on your group size.

listes.name: Sophie – France
listes.comment: A wonderful escape from the hustle of Marrakech. The Ourika Valley is beautiful, with lush landscapes and traditional Berber villages. The hike to the Setti Fatma waterfalls was refreshing and not too difficult. A perfect day trip for nature lovers.

listes.name: Mark – United Kingdom
listes.comment: An excellent day in the Atlas Mountains. The scenery along the Ourika Valley was stunning, and the visit to the argan oil cooperative was very interesting. Our driver was friendly and informative, making the journey smooth and enjoyable.

listes.name: Lina – Italy
listes.comment: Beautiful landscapes and an authentic cultural experience. I loved walking through the Berber villages and enjoying lunch by the river. The waterfalls at Setti Fatma were impressive and well worth the short hike. Highly recommended.

listes.question: How long does the trip take?
listes.repense: The excursion lasts approximately 10–11 hours.

listes.question: Is there free time in Essaouira?
listes.repense: Yes, you will have free time to explore the beach, medina, or port at your own pace.

listes.question: Do I need to book lunch in advance?
listes.repense: No, lunch is optional and can be chosen on-site from various local restaurants.

listes.question: Is the guided tour included?
listes.repense: Yes, a guided walking tour of the medina and Skala is included.

tours.to: Day Trip from Fes to Chefchaouen
tours.titre: Day Trip from Fes to Chefchaouen - Fes Excursion

about.titre: Day Trip from Fes to Chefchaouen
about.paragraph1: Embark on a day trip from Fes to Chefchaouen, the famous blue city nestled in the Rif Mountains.
about.paragraph2: Known for its picturesque blue-painted streets and peaceful atmosphere, it offers a truly unique Moroccan experience.

programme.titre: ITINERARY DAY TRIP FROM FES TO CHEFCHAOUEN

text: Your journey begins with an early morning departure from Fes, followed by a scenic drive through the beautiful Rif Mountains. Upon arrival in Chefchaouen, you’ll start a guided tour of the city, beginning with a visit to the Kasbah Museum and the Grand Mosque. You’ll then stroll through the iconic blue-painted streets and vibrant local markets, taking in the charm and unique atmosphere of this picturesque town.

Afterward, you may choose to enjoy lunch in a local restaurant (optional) before heading to the Spanish Mosque, where you can admire breathtaking panoramic views of the city. You will then have free time to explore Chefchaouen at your own pace, wandering through its serene alleys or relaxing in one of its charming cafés. In the evening, you will return to Fes, ending a day filled with unforgettable sights and experiences.

infos.titre: Tour From Fes to Chefchaouen Informations

includes: Transport in a comfortable vehicle
English/French-speaking driver/guide
Pickup and drop-off at your accommodation in Fes

important.text: Wear comfortable shoes and bring water for the walk.

priceText.text: Contact us for the best price based on your group size.

listes.name: Emma Wilson – USA
listes.comment: Chefchaouen is absolutely magical! The blue streets were even more beautiful in person. A must-do trip from Fes!

listes.name: Mohamed El Idrissi – Morocco
listes.comment: Great organization and comfortable ride. The Spanish Mosque viewpoint was breathtaking. Highly recommended.

listes.name: Rebecca Lee – Canada
listes.comment: Wonderful visit to the blue city. I loved the calm atmosphere. The tour was well-paced, but I wish we had a bit more free time.

listes.question: How long is the journey from Fes to Chefchaouen?
listes.repense: The drive takes around 3.5 to 4 hours each way.

listes.question: Is Chefchaouen walking-friendly?
listes.repense: Yes, the city is very pedestrian-friendly, but some areas include uphill streets.

listes.question: Is the entrance to the Kasbah Museum included?
listes.repense: Entrance fees are not included and must be paid on-site.

listes.question: Can I explore Chefchaouen on my own?
listes.repense: Yes, after the guided introduction, you will have free time to explore independently.

tours.to: Day Trip to Middle Atlas From Fes

about.titre: Day Trip from Fes to Middle Atlas: Cedar forest, Ifrane, Azrou
about.paragraph1: The day trip to the Middle Atlas, cedar forest, Azrou and Ifran, starts with a pick up from your accommodation in Fes. Then visit the Middle Atlas Mountains, and also Ifrane a ski town in the high peaks of Morocco. Thereafter, follow the trails through the cedar forests to meet the Barbary macaque, and have a chance to feed them. In addition to that visit Daiet Aoua lake, and also the city of Azrou. Finally, we drop you off at your hotel in Fes.

programme.titre: ITINERARY DAY TRIP FROM FES TO MIDDLE ATLAS

text: The day trip starts by picking you up from your accommodation in Fes. Then, we drive south through the small town of Immouzer Kandar. Then we take a detour to the magnificent Daiet Aoua lake: and admire the surrounding hills. Thereafter, we continue to visit Ifrane, famous for its low temperature, snow and the alpine-style houses -No wonder it is called the Switzerland of Morocco. Then we drive to Azrou to visit the cedars forest, where the Barbary Macaques live. Feel free to feed them while wandering in the forest. Finally, we drive back to Fes.
Depending on time spend in sites, we might visit additional places.

infos.titre: Tour From Fes To Middle Atlass

includes: Pickup and drop-off at your Hotel or Airport
transportation in a private 4x4 or a minivan with A/C +Fuel.
English/French-speaking driver

important.text: Wear comfortable shoes and bring water for the walk.

priceText.text: Contact us for the best price based on your group size.

listes.name: Emma – Germany
listes.comment: A fantastic day trip from Fes. The landscapes of the Middle Atlas are stunning, especially the cedar forest where we saw Barbary macaques up close. Ifrane was a pleasant surprise with its clean streets and alpine-style houses. Very well organized.

listes.name: Carlos – Spain
listes.comment: This excursion was the perfect way to discover a different side of Morocco. The stop at Dayet Aoua Lake was peaceful, and the visit to Azrou’s cedar forest was unforgettable. Our driver was professional and shared interesting information along the way.

listes.name: Nina – Netherlands
listes.comment: Highly recommended if you are staying in Fes. The Middle Atlas offers beautiful nature and cooler weather. Feeding the monkeys in the cedar forest was a highlight for us. Comfortable transport and a smooth, enjoyable day.

listes.question: How long does the trip take?
listes.repense: The excursion lasts approximately 10–11 hours.

listes.question: Is there free time in Essaouira?
listes.repense: Yes, you will have free time to explore the beach, medina, or port at your own pace.

listes.question: Do I need to book lunch in advance?
listes.repense: No, lunch is optional and can be chosen on-site from various local restaurants.

listes.question: Is the guided tour included?
listes.repense: Yes, a guided walking tour of the medina and Skala is included.

tours.to: Day Trip to Meknes and Volubilis Ruins From Fes

about.titre: Day Trip from Fes to Meknes and Volubilis Ruins
about.paragraph1: Day trip to Volubilis and Meknes starts from your accommodation in Fes. Then we drive to explore Meknes the Ismaili capital, and also one of the imperial cities in Morocco. After that visit the historic ruins of Volubilis, listed as World Heritage by UNESCO. Finally the day trip end by drop off at your hotel in Fes

programme.titre: ITINERARY DAY TRIP FROM FES TO MEKNES AND VOLUBILIS RUINS

jours.jour: Day 1: Fes - Volubilis Ruins - Meknes - Fes
text: The day trip starts with an early pick up from the airport or your accommodation in Fes. Then we depart to visit Meknes, the Ismaili capital and also one of the imperial cities of Morocco. In which we visit: Bab Al-Mansour, Sahrij Souani basin, the Royal stables, the granary and also the Moulay Ismail Mausoleum. Free time for lunch. Thereafter, we drive 30 km away from Meknes to visit the ancient Roman ruins of Volubilis. It is well preserved, as it is recognized as a World Heritage Site by the UNESCO. It has many beautiful mosaics scattered here and there, along with ancient pillars and archways.
After that we head back to fes. Finelly the day trip ends with a drop off at you accommodation.

infos.titre: Tour From Fes To Meknes And Volubilis Ruins Informations

includes: Transportation in a private 4x4 or a minivan with A/C +Fuel.
Private Driver Speaking English.
Pick-up from your Raid or any Location in Fes
Stops on the way for panoramic views.
Drop Off at any Location in Fes

important.text: Wear comfortable shoes and bring water for the walk.

priceText.text: Contact us for the best price based on your group size.

listes.name: Laura – France
listes.comment: An excellent historical day trip from Fes. Meknes is impressive, especially Bab Al-Mansour and the royal stables. Volubilis was the highlight of the day, with incredibly well-preserved mosaics and ruins. Everything was well organized.

listes.name: Mark – United Kingdom
listes.comment: A perfect mix of history and culture. Visiting Meknes gave us great insight into Morocco’s imperial past, and Volubilis was simply breathtaking. The driver was knowledgeable and made the journey comfortable and enjoyable.

listes.name: Sofia – Italy
listes.comment: Highly recommended for history lovers. Volubilis is one of the most impressive Roman sites we’ve seen in North Africa. The tour was smooth, informative, and well-paced, with enough time to explore both Meknes and the ruins.

listes.question: How long does the trip take?
listes.repense: The excursion lasts approximately 10–11 hours.

listes.question: Is there free time in Essaouira?
listes.repense: Yes, you will have free time to explore the beach, medina, or port at your own pace.

listes.question: Do I need to book lunch in advance?
listes.repense: No, lunch is optional and can be chosen on-site from various local restaurants.

listes.question: Is the guided tour included?
listes.repense: Yes, a guided walking tour of the medina and Skala is included.
